title: Bug 108822: More efficient logic is expected for processing disk sorting with border values in row values
OB: The current logic for processing disk sorting with border values in row values is inefficient.
EB: More efficient logic is expected for processing disk sorting with border values in row values. Specifically, the data should be sorted directly in memory before writing it to the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk. 
2. Set the program to process the data less than 40000 rows. 
3. Observe the following operations: 
   a. Save the file as a temporary file. 
   b. Load the file into memory. 
   c. Sort the data in memory. 
   d. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file.
